Expected Utility Theory¶

funcsim.eut(util, outcomes, precision=0.001)[source]

Compute expected utility and certainty equivalent income.

Parameters:

  • util (Callable) – Utility function that takes a float as its sole argument and returns a float

  • outcomes (VectorLike) – Sequence of monetary outcomes (all must be positive).

  • precition (float, optional) – Precision parameter used in solving for the certainty equivalent. The default value is 0.001

Returns:

Named tuple with fields:

ExpectedValuefloat

The mean isoelastic utility of the outcomes.

CertaintyEquivfloat

The certainty equivalent income.

Return type:

EutResult

funcsim.utilIsoelastic(y, crra)[source]

Compute isoelastic (CRRA) utility for a monetary outcome.

Parameters:

  • y (float) – Monetary outcome (must be >= 1.0).

  • crra (float) – Constant relative risk aversion coefficient (must be non-negative).

Returns:

Isoelastic utility value for the given outcome and CRRA.

Return type:

float
